elements.title: Charles Wolley-Dod (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British Imperial Airways manager Charles Wolley-Dod (pictured) and two crew members were killed in an unexplained plane crash in Germany in 1937?

elements.title: convex curves (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Archimedes first defined convex curves, mathematicians lost interest in their analysis until the 19th century, more than two millennia later?

elements.title: Diane Haigh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British architect Diane Haigh transformed one historic building into an art gallery and another into a hospice?

elements.title: 2022 Independence Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dana Holgorsen coached Houston in the 2022 Independence Bowl while wearing a jacket that honored Mike Leach, his late coach and mentor?

elements.title: Liu Ji'en (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Liu Ji'en was assassinated just 60 days after being crowned the emperor of the Northern Han?

elements.title: Sonic Frontiers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the developers of Sonic felt the series' linear design contained "little room for evolution" so they decided to make Sonic Frontiers an open world game?

elements.title: Miguel Barbosa Huerta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Governor Miguel Barbosa Huerta said that his predecessor's death in office was a punishment from God – and then died in office himself?

elements.title: Bothie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bothie was the only dog to "set paw" on both the North and South poles?
